avahi4j
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  avahi4j.Client

public class Client
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the entry point of Avahi4J. A client can be used to:

  • publish new services,
  • browse the network for specific services and
  • retrieve client details (hostname, domain name, FQDN and state).
A client MUST be released when done by calling release().

Instantiation

A client can be created using either of the constructors. If a IClientCallback object is provided to the constructor, the callback object will be notified when the client's Client.State changes.

Starting the client

After instantiation, a client must be started by calling start(), before either registering new services or browsing for existing ones. Calling any of the set/get methods can be done with a client started or stopped however.

Registering a new service

With a client started, create an EntryGroup using createEntryGroup(IEntryGroupCallback) or createEntryGroup(IEntryGroupCallback). Add as many services as required using addService() and publish them using EntryGroup.commit(). Make sure you also release the entry group when no longer needed. See EntryGroup and the TestServicePublish sample application for more information.

Browsing for existing services

With a client started, create a ServiceBrowser by calling createServiceBrowser(). The provided callback object will be called every time an event occurs on a matching service (service added, removed, error, ...). Again, make sure you release service browser objects (by calling ServiceBrowser.release() when no longer needed. See ServiceBrowser and the TestServiceBrowser sample application for more information.

Stopping the client

You can stop the client by calling stop(). After that, no more callbacks to existing service browsers/entry groups/the client itself will be made.

Releasing the client

Once the client is no longer needed, it must be released by calling release(). Existing ServiceBrowser, EntryGroup and ServiceResolver object must be released PRIOR to releasing the client.

Author:
gilles

createServiceBrowser

public ServiceBrowser createServiceBrowser(IServiceBrowserCallback callback,
                                           int interfaceNum,
                                           Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                                           java.lang.String type,
                                           java.lang.String domain,
                                           int lookupFlags)
                                    throws Avahi4JException
This method create a new ServiceBrowser object used to look for services of a given type.

Parameters:
callback - the object which will receive notification of matching services
interfaceNum - the interface number to be used for browsing, or Avahi4JConstants.AnyInterface to browse on all available interfaces
proto - the Avahi4JConstants.Protocol to use for browsing (in most cases, you want to use Avahi4JConstants.Protocol.ANY).
type - the service type to browse (for instance '_workstation._tcp')
domain - the domain to browse (set it to null to browse on all domains)
lookupFlags - lookup flags (See LOOKUP_* in Avahi4JConstants)
Returns:
a service browser object which MUST be released (by calling ServiceBrowser.release()) when done.
Throws:
Avahi4JException - if there is an error creating the service browser

createServiceResolver

public ServiceResolver createServiceResolver(IServiceResolverCallback callback,
                                             int ifNum,
                                             Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String type,
                                             java.lang.String domain,
                                             Avahi4JConstants.Protocol addressProtocol,
                                             int lookupFlags)
                                      throws Avahi4JException
This method create a new ServiceResolver object used to resolve services, ie find out the IP address of the server and associated TXT records. The returned service resolver can be used to monitor changes to a given service (for example, a change in the TXT records) as long as the service resolver is active (ie, not released).

Parameters:
ifNum - the interface the service is running on. Pass the exact interface number as received by a service browser.
proto - the protocol used by the service. Pass the exact protocol as received by a service browser.
name - the name of the service. Pass the exact name as received by a service browser
type - the service type. Pass the exact type as received by a service browser
domain - the domain the service belongs to. Pass the exact domain as received by a service browser
addressProtocol - the protocol of the address to be resolved
lookupFlags - lookup flags (See LOOKUP_* in Avahi4JConstants)
Returns:
a service resolver object which MUST be released (by calling ServiceResolver.release()) when done. As long as the service resolver is active (ie, not released), updates to the service, such as changes to the service's TXT records or service removal, will be delivered to the resolver.
Throws:
Avahi4JException - if there is an error creating the service resolver

createRecordBrowser

public RecordBrowser createRecordBrowser(IRecordBrowserCallback callback,
                                         int interfaceIdx,
                                         Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                                         java.lang.String name,
                                         Avahi4JConstants.DNS_Class clazz,
                                         Avahi4JConstants.DNS_RRType type,
                                         int lookupFlags)
                                  throws Avahi4JException
This method creates a new RecordBrowser object which can be used to query specific records for a host.

Parameters:
callback - the callback object which will receive the answer to the query
interfaceIdx - the interface where the query should be issued
proto - the protocol used by the query
name - the hostname
clazz - the Avahi4JConstants.DNS_Class
type - the Avahi4JConstants.DNS_RRType to be queried
lookupFlags - lookup flags (See @link Avahi4JConstants.LOOKUP_*)
Returns:
a record browser object which must be released (by calling RecordBrowser.release() when done.
Throws:
Avahi4JException - if there is an error creating the record browser

resolveService

public static ResolvedService resolveService(int ifNum,
                                             Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String type,
                                             java.lang.String domain,
                                             Avahi4JConstants.Protocol addressProtocol,
                                             int lookupFlags)
                                      throws Avahi4JException
This method resolves a service, blocks until the result is received and returns it.

Parameters:
ifNum - the interface the service is running on. Pass the exact interface number as received by a service browser.
proto - the protocol used by the service. Pass the exact protocol as received by a service browser.
name - the name of the service. Pass the exact name as received by a service browser
type - the service type. Pass the exact type as received by a service browser
domain - the domain the service belongs to. Pass the exact domain as received by a service browser
addressProtocol - the protocol of the address to be looked up
lookupFlags - lookup flags (See Avahi4JConstants.LOOKUP_* in Avahi4JConstants)
Returns:
a ResolvedService object containing the details of the resolve service.
Throws:
Avahi4JException - if there is an error resolving the service
